page.title: 06FARMING IN 1885
page.content: because the tractor can travel faster and can plough five or six furrows at one time. When the harvesting came they did not use bales but instead they stacked the stooks into a pyramid shape. This would be made with a lot of trouble and then someone would put rope or twine around the middle of it. These would be put on to a cart and pulled by a horse and taken back to the farm for storing in a haystack or a barn. Nowadays we have balers which, after the turning and drying, would be used to bale the hay/straw. The machine would take up some hay/straw, thrash it and then it would make it into a square and it would be bound with twine and let out of the machine again through an exit hole. Hay making was the main harvest in those days but now we do have silaging
